author: pmcgoohan
content:
Ok sure, although the p2p logic seems nearly identical for txs and blocks.
The nodes have 100 connections each so I'd expect that to be enough to bypass some nodes withholding.
It feels like something else is going on to do with the pending/queueing logic, as this is unique to tx p2p.
It'll help when I can see what these tx are and whether they are valid.
One thought (pure conjecture) given that gas price oscillates under 1559:
- you send a tx that would be valid in the current block
- by the time it reaches a node the base price has gone up and is too high for the tx to execute
- so the node queues it rather than adding it to pending and does not relay, and then fails to move it to pending
